transportAdvice: Nantucket is a compact island where the town center is very walkable, and bicycles are a popular and practical way to explore further afield. A local bus system serves key areas including beaches and villages, and taxis are available, though demand is high in peak summer months.

weather.description: Cold and often blustery with occasional snow, making it a quiet off-season period with few visitors.
Similar to January, with raw cold and wind off the Atlantic keeping temperatures well below freezing at night.
Early signs of spring emerge but the island remains cool and often grey with lingering winter chill.
Mild and gradually warming, with daffodils blooming and the island beginning to stir ahead of the summer season.
Pleasant and increasingly sunny, a lovely time to visit before summer crowds arrive and prices peak.
Warm and inviting with long daylight hours, marking the start of the busy summer tourist season.
Peak summer with warm beach weather, high humidity, and the island at its most lively and crowded.
Continues the warm, sunny summer pattern with busy beaches and the highest visitor numbers of the year.
A beautiful shoulder month with warm temperatures, fewer crowds, and a relaxed end-of-summer atmosphere.
Crisp autumn air and colorful foliage make this a charming time to visit as the island quiets down significantly.
Cool and often overcast with the island largely returning to its quiet off-season pace.
Cold and wintry with festive holiday events drawing some visitors, but most of the island is closed or reduced in service.
